content: mouse all in one amigurumi pattern by criss wall i started crocheting small toys to leave around for people to find i found mouse toys were surprisingly popular and at first i couldn t put my finger on why later i found out people were taking them for their cats they made perfect cat toys…… lol i know that there are some lovely mouse patterns out there already i specifically wanted a pattern that didn t involve sewing on additional parts later i just wanted to make them in one piece i have included two variations to the same pattern below the 2 row written in green are for a mouse without feet my pattern contains basic instructions meant for someone who is already familiar crocheting amigurumi it is important to keep track of the beginnings of each row in this pattern notes  you can use 10 ply/aran yarn with 4mm hook or 8ply/dk with a 3 0mm or 3 5mm or your choice of yarn and hook  depending on your hook size they measure around 4-5cm high 13-15cm long including the tail  i use about 20 metres of yarn for each mouse  you will need safety eyes and stuffing as well stitches  chain chain  single_crochet single_crochet  half_double_crochet half_double_crochet  double_crochet double_crochet  increase increase  decrease decrease  yo4 bobble a bobble stitch where you yarn over 4 times and have 5 loops on your hook then pull through all of them  yo5 bobble a bobble stitch where you yarn over 5 times and have 6 loops on your hook and pull through all of them  front loop work the stitch in the front loop only criss wall https //www ravelry com/patterns/library/all-in-one-mouse instructions tail chain 24 with the first chain being reasonably tight slip_stitch in second chain from the hook and single_crochet 2 increase in each of the next 6 chain single_crochet in each of the next 14 chain stitches excluding the last place a stitch marker or use a piece of yarn to mark the end of the tail this pattern begins with the tail but if you find the start difficult you can easily substitute a magic_ring with 6 single_crochet and begin from there when you have completed a few row just tie your tail in after i have this hairy yarn that i love tying in as the tail the tail length can be adjusted by adding to the number of chain at the start also if you want a really curly tail add more single_crochet increase along the chain row 1 single_crochet 6 into the last stitch 6 if you crochet over two strands of the starting chain it makes a smaller hole these 6 single_crochet s are the start of the mouse s butt continue with row 2 without joining the tail needs to be bent towards you so the first single_crochet of row 2 will need to be behind the tail row 2 *increase
